result.reason: RDP SendKeys API (IMsRdpClientNonScriptable5.SendKeys) is already available in the codebase and VNC already has this feature - extending to RDP is straightforward
result.approach: Add SendSpecialKeys() to RdpProtocol using IMsRdpClientNonScriptable5.SendKeys() API, then extend the existing VNC-only 'Send Special Keys' context menu in ConnectionWindow to also work for RDP connections, supporting Ctrl+Alt+Del and Ctrl+Alt+End
